medical_history.chief_complaint: New onset of severe acute abdominal pain in epigastrium with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began one day prior to admission, with severe, sharp abdominal pain and associated nausea and vomiting. The patient has not been eating. The emesis was non-bloody but bilious. Previous ultrasound was negative for GB or biliary tree disease. There has been no recent bright red blood per rectum or melena. The patient did not have fevers or chills.
medical_history.family_history: Mother, aunt, and maternal grandmother all have IBS; no history of IBD.
